abstract: Essay by David Waldstein recalls covering Game 7 of 1997 World Series, in which he wrote articles on both possible outcomes; notes Florida Marlins, now named Miami Marlins, came back to win game over Cleveland Indians in extra innings to secure championship.

headline.print_headline: In 1997, an Indians Title Was Put in Writing, Until the Story Changed
headline.main: In 1997, an Indians Title Was Put in Writing, Until the Story Changed

snippet: Facing deadline pressure, a reporter typed out a sentence in the bottom of the ninth inning in Game 7 pronouncing the Indians the world champions. But the game wasn’t over....
lead_paragraph: Facing deadline pressure, a reporter typed out a sentence in the bottom of the ninth inning in Game 7 pronouncing the Indians the world champions. But the game wasn’t over.
